verses.verse: And it came to pass after<WH310> these things<WH1697>, that one said<WH559> to Joseph<WH3130>, Behold<WH1>, thy father is sick<WH2470>: and he took<WH3947> with him his two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>, Manasseh<WH4519> and Ephraim<WH669>.

And one told<WH5046> Jacob<WH3290>, and said<WH559>, Behold<WH1121>, thy son Joseph<WH3130> cometh<WH935> unto thee<WH3478>: and Israel strengthened<WH2388> himself<WH3427>, and sat upon the bed<WH4296>.
And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, God<WH410> Almighty<WH7706> appeared<WH7200> unto me at Luz<WH3870> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and blessed me<WH1288>,

and said<WH559> unto me<WH6509>, Behold, I will make thee fruitful, and multiply<WH7235> thee<WH5414>, and I will make of thee a company<WH6951> of peoples<WH5971>, and will give<WH5414> this land<WH776> to thy seed<WH2233> after thee<WH310> for an everlasting<WH5769> possession<WH272>.

And now thy two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>, who were born<WH3205> unto thee in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> before<WH5704> I came<WH935> unto thee into Egypt<WH4714>, are mine<WH669>; Ephraim and Manasseh<WH4519>, even as Reuben<WH7205> and Simeon<WH8095>, shall be mine.

And thy issue<WH4138>, that thou begettest<WH3205> after<WH310> them<WH7121>, shall be thine; they shall be called after<WH5921> the name<WH8034> of their brethren<WH251> in their inheritance<WH5159>.

And as for me<WH935>, when I came from Paddan<WH6307>, Rachel<WH7354> died<WH4191> by me in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> in the way<WH1870>, when<WH5750> there was still some<WH3530> distance<WH776> to come<WH935> unto Ephrath<WH672>: and I buried her<WH6912> there in the way<WH1870> to Ephrath<WH672> (the same is Beth-lehem<WH1035>).
And Israel<WH3478> beheld<WH7200> Joseph<WH3130>'s sons<WH1121>, and said<WH559>, Who are these?

And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, They are my sons<WH1121>, whom God<WH430> hath given<WH5414> me here<WH559>. And he said, Bring them<WH3947>, I pray thee<WH1288>, unto me, and I will bless them.

Now the eyes<WH5869> of Israel<WH3478> were dim<WH3513> for age<WH2207>, so that he could<WH3201> not see<WH7200>. And he brought them near<WH5066> unto him<WH5401>; and he kissed them<WH2263>, and embraced them.
And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, I had not thought<WH6419> to see<WH7200> thy face<WH6440>: and<WH430>, lo, God hath let me see<WH7200> thy seed also<WH2233>.
And Joseph<WH3130> brought them out<WH3318> from between<WH5973> his knees<WH1290>; and he bowed<WH7812> himself with his face<WH639> to the earth<WH776>.

And Joseph<WH3130> took<WH3947> them both<WH8147>, Ephraim<WH669> in his right hand<WH3225> toward Israel<WH3478>'s left hand<WH8040>, and Manasseh<WH4519> in his left hand<WH8040> toward Israel<WH3478>'s right hand<WH3225>, and brought them near unto him<WH5066>.

And Israel<WH3478> stretched out<WH7971> his right hand<WH3225>, and laid<WH7896> it upon Ephraim<WH669>'s head<WH7218>, who was the younger<WH6810>, and his left hand<WH8040> upon Manasseh<WH4519>'s head<WH7218>, guiding<WH7919> his hands<WH3027> wittingly<WH7919>; for Manasseh<WH4519> was the first-born<WH1060>.

And he blessed<WH1288> Joseph<WH3130>, and said<WH559>, The God<WH430> before<WH6440> whom my fathers<WH1> Abraham<WH85> and Isaac<WH3327> did walk<WH1980>, the God<WH430> who hath fed<WH7462> me all my life long<WH5750> unto this day<WH3117>,

the angel<WH4397> who hath redeemed<WH1350> me from all evil<WH7451>, bless<WH1288> the lads<WH5288>; and let my name<WH8034> be named<WH8034> on them<WH8034>, and the name of my fathers<WH1> Abraham<WH85> and Isaac<WH3327>; and let them grow<WH1711> into a multitude<WH7230> in the midst<WH7130> of the earth<WH776>.

And when Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> that his father<WH1> laid<WH7896> his right<WH3225> hand<WH3027> upon the head<WH7218> of Ephraim<WH669>, it displeased<WH3415> him<WH8551>: and he held up his father<WH1>'s hand<WH3027>, to remove<WH5493> it from Ephraim<WH669>'s head<WH7218> unto Manasseh<WH4519>'s head<WH7218>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, Not so<WH1>, my father; for this is the first-born<WH1060>; put<WH7760> thy right hand<WH3225> upon his head<WH7218>.

And his father<WH1> refused<WH3985>, and said<WH559>, I know<WH3045> it<WH1121>, my son, I know<WH3045> it<WH5971>; he also shall become a people, and he also shall be great<WH1431>: howbeit<WH199> his younger<WH6996> brother<WH251> shall be greater<WH1431> than he<WH2233>, and his seed shall become a multitude<WH4393> of nations<WH1471>.

And he blessed<WH1288> them that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>, In thee will Israel<WH3478> bless<WH1288>, saying<WH559>, God<WH430> make<WH7760> thee as Ephraim<WH669> and as Manasseh<WH4519>: and he set<WH7760> Ephraim<WH669> before<WH6440> Manasseh<WH4519>.
And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, Behold<WH4191>, I die: but God<WH430> will be with you<WH7725>, and bring you again unto the land<WH776> of your fathers<WH1>.

Moreover I have given<WH5414> to thee one<WH259> portion<WH7926> above thy brethren<WH251>, which I took<WH3947> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Amorite<WH567> with my sword<WH2719> and with my bow<WH7198>.
